title: Revamp the Honor-initiative to decrease toxicity and make for a more fun Game-environment
body:
So, it's been months since I've last seen someone with a Honor badge and I haven't been using the system myself, seeing that it doesn't feel really Impactful and doesn't seem to do its job to reward other players for their great attitude or teamplay.

League has had this stigma to it, saying that the community might just be the most toxic in gaming history and sometimes the game environment can feel really hostile, especially to new players.
I personally feel in order for the community to grow through interacting in the game itself the Honor initiative has to be revamped.

We already nerd out about Fanart, Cosplay and other stuff, League being a great basis to socialize and express yourself but in game this kinda falls short at times due to the lack of initiative to actually interact with fellow players-
"OMG NOOB JUNGLER NO GANKS" Is a lot more common than maybe friendly banter or tips and I feel this could easily be fixed if we were to revamp the Honor initiative to actually reward shining examples of the league community.

Just like Overwatch the end screen should entail some High-End stats and a few medals you could distribute to your team, giving them the usual stuff like "Friendly", "Teamwork" but also "MVP", "Shotcaller" but also funny stuff like "Humorous" or simply "Funky Playstyle" for that one Singed top that made the game look like a frigging circus.

The System is outdated, yes and there needs to be some actual reasons to actually award players.
Badges, more Hextech crafting components and more would help people actually want to Honor and give them a reason to socialize and see the other players for what they are:
Human beings.

Any other ideas on how to improve this outdated function with so much untapped potential?


http://pm1.narvii.com/5772/54522b6e4182a9769c11ff7661146e0e45d27a7a_hq.jpg

I think all we need to do for now is make it visible and see what happens. Right now, honor system is a bit hidden. 

At least in the legacy client, you have to actually *look* for the buttons and you don't get a notification that you've been honor'd until you leave the post-game stats screen. In Overwatch, you get clicks that build anticipation every time you get a stack of commend. Then some nice cheery effects and a voice line from your character at some number of stacks. And it feels pretty damn good.

I think just a little cosmetic touch up that gives instant gratification would help a lot.

Whats more is they GIVE something. Its bonus XP, which in turn means a speedier gain of the next level up, and the chest that come with it. It could have a skin, or a play of the game intro, or some other sweet something in it. Playing well, and earning the upvotes rewards you.

The honor system here.... gives something no one cares about.

If you want something to work, you have to give something for it.... if only we could reward people with something in this game...

I dont know... RP? Not even a lot, just maybe 10 RP for X number of honor votes, say every 50? Also let people know what the votes are worth. People who honer everyone should see the honer they can give out diminish to nothing so they stop doing it. Penalize peoples honor if they honor an opponent player that was punished, i.e. honoring an intent feeder for helping you win. Show the receiver how much honer they get, and the giver how much they give.

Let this role over into a reward. Behavior is affected by carrot and stick methods all the time. People play honorably, they can get a carrot. People who dont get a stick.

Riot is too lazy to update champion's VO while doing a VU.

I don't expect them doing anything like Overwatch has, sadly.
Should be able to buy things with honor point things. Maybe certain champions, or like a screen border or whatever.
Then everyone would be offering H4H (honor for honor) and the system would be abused.
So whats wrong with that?? People still wont honor someone that pissed them off in game.

what's the point of the honor system if it's only used for people just to give honor so they can get honor

you're supposed to give honor to players you enjoyed playing with rather than for some form of reward

I challenge you to find ANY way to incentivize the honor system without any chance of it being abusable.

Keep in mind you don't see honors earned until after exiting the post-game lobby. If you do try to initiate an "honor 4 honor" deal, there's nothing to stop me from saying "sure" and not actually honoring.

..the same way op is saying to do it, make the honor system more like overwatch's post-game screen

make it blatant what stats / cool things players did and then put the option to honor them right next to the stat, out of the three you can give allies or honorable opponent to enemies

the honor system doesn't need a reward, it just needs to be more obvious. in both clients the honor button is tiny and you have to really want to hand out an honor to even remember it's there, whereas putting up some score cards that could be champion specific, e.g., "(nautilus / thresh / blitz / playername) landed (x amount / x amount out of amount thrown) hooks" or "(soraka / sona / playername) healed near-death teammates (x amount) times", or just universal stats such as damage done / objectives assisted in / etc, would make it more obvious

instead of thinking "all udyr did was split push the entire game he was useless" you'd get a score card of how many turrets he took and think "what the hell he took out seven turrets??" and the option to honor him would be right next to this stat
Guys you can't honour the same person over and over, I assure you it dosen't work, the honour counts alot less towards ribbions if done twice to the same person.

I remember shortly after they added it they made it harder to get honor ribbons. They could start by reverting that.

Another thing that would help is adding something to the end game lobby next to the leave lobby button saying Honor players? Currently you have to click on a tiny button if you wish to honor a player. Add in no real benefit in doing this and you have no reason to do it. Or perhaps making players have a popup screen once they return to the lobby asking to select a player to receive honor. 

If they were to have a end of season reward for being in the top 25% of players with honor rating (honor rating is not based on how many honor you but the % of the time you get honored and have a set minimum of total to get a ribbon) that might also be of use. Say there was a skin offered at the end of the season for most honorable players like there is a victorious skin for all gold and higher players that might promote better behavior.

The real challenge however is making players remember to give honor and making group farming of honor minimally impactful or completely ineffective.

My fix is to give 1RP for every badge you get per game (capped at 5). That is enough incentive for people to start doing it even thou it takes forever to farm a skin (but youc an farm ip boost on aram and other stuff that cost 75rp pretty fast)

Oh, people would be forming clubs/chat rooms just to queue up and farm RP.  While I like thinking that people would use it properly (and some would), there are more that would abuse the crap out of it.

people used to think the same about the free chest and it got fixed with the cap riot put. Maybe give RP the first games and IP the rest and give a min of time the match would need to last (say 30 min). That should reduce the abusers considerably.
